title: How to Make Your Own Instant Noodle Cups

methods.name: Preparing Homemade Sesame Ginger Instant Noodles

steps.headline: Combine all of the ingredients in a jar.
steps.description: Add the chicken stock concentrate, sesame oil, soy sauce, finely grated ginger, whole wheat spaghetti, frozen vegetables, shredded chicken, and toasted sesame seeds to a heat-safe mason jar or stoneware mug with a lid. Make sure to add the ingredients in the proper order. You can substitute zucchini or carrot noodles for the whole wheat pasta. You can add whatever frozen vegetables you like. A mix made for stir fry that contains veggies such as carrots, peppers, broccoli, and/or water chestnuts is a good option. If you don’t have leftover chicken to add to the jar, you can shred the meat from a grocery store rotisserie chicken.

steps.headline: Store in the refrigerator until ready to eat.
steps.description: Once all of the ingredients are in your container, place the lid on to seal it. Keep the container in your refrigerator until you are ready to eat. The instant noodles will keep in your refrigerator for 3 to 5 days. If you’re bringing the noodles with you to work or school, make sure to throw a cold pack into your lunch bag to keep them cold.

steps.headline: Add boiling water to the jar and steep the noodles for several minutes.
steps.description: When you’re ready to eat the noodles, fill the container with boiling water to an 1-inch (2.5-cm) below the top. Place the lid on the container, and allow the noodles to steep for 2 to 3 minutes. If your container is microwave-safe, you can also add lukewarm water to the container and microwave it on high for 1 to 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Stir the noodles well before eating.
steps.description: After you’ve allowed the noodles to steep for a couple of minutes, remove the lid. Use a spoon to stir the noodles and ingredients together well to ensure that the chicken stock concentrate has dissolved completely before eating.

methods.name: Whipping Up Homemade Thai Coconut Curry with Shrimp Instant Noodles

steps.headline: Divide all ingredients except the scallions and limes between 4 jars.
steps.description: Evenly distribute the chicken stock base, brown sugar, red curry paste, chili-garlic sauce, fish sauce, cooked shrimp, shiitake mushrooms, coconut milk, and pre-cooked ramen noodles or spaghetti between 4 resealable, heat-safe pint size (473 ml) glass jars. There’s no need to mix the ingredients. You can find red curry paste in the Asian section of many grocery stores. You can substitute button mushrooms for the shiitake if you prefer.

steps.headline: Place the limes and scallions in plastic bags and set in the jars.
steps.description: Divide 1 cup (100 g) of thinly sliced scallions and 1 lime that’s been cut into wedges between 4 resealable plastic zipper bags. Fold them up and place them at the top of the jars. Keeping the scallions and lime separate from the other ingredients allows you to stir them into the noodles just before you eat for the freshest flavor.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the jars until you’re ready to eat.
steps.description: After all of the ingredients are in the jars, seal them closed with their lids. Place the jars in the refrigerator until you are ready to eat them. The noodles will keep for up to 4 days in your refrigerator. If you’re traveling with the noodles, you should add a cold pack or frozen bottle of water to your bag to keep them cold.

steps.headline: Remove the scallion and lime bags and add boiling water to the jar.
steps.description: When you’re ready to eat your noodles, remove the lid from the jar. Lift the plastic bag with the scallions and lime out, and pour in enough boiling water to reach the top of the jar. Replace the lid, and allow the noodles to sit for at least 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Stir in the scallions and squeeze in the lime before eating.
steps.description: After you’ve allowed the noodles to step for a couple of minutes, remove the lid from the jar. Stir in the scallions, and squeeze the lime over the noodles before you begin to eat. You can eat the noodles directly out of the jar or pour them into a bowl to eat.

steps.headline: Mix all of the ingredients in a jar.
steps.description: Add the par-cooked ramen noodles, green onion, pickled ginger, fried shiitake mushrooms, carrot, peas, soy sauce, sesame seed oil, vegetable bouillon cube, and spicy chili oil to a heatproof glass jar that holds at least 4 cups (1 liter) and has a lid. Make to sure to place the ingredients in the jar in the proper order. Par cooking the noodles means slightly undercooking them. You can substitute spaghetti for the ramen noodles if you prefer. If you don’t want spicy noodles, you can omit the spicy chili oil.

steps.headline: Store the jar in the refrigerator until ready to eat.
steps.description: After you’ve added all of the ingredients to the jar, seal it closed with the lid. Place the jar in the refrigerator until you are ready to eat the noodles. The noodles will keep in your refrigerator for 3 to 4 days. If you’re packing the noodles for lunch, make sure to include a cold pack.

steps.headline: Add boiling water to the jar and allow to steep for several minutes.
steps.description: When you’re ready to eat the noodles, remove the lid from the jar. Add boiling water to it to just cover all of the noodles and vegetables. Cover the jar, and let the noodles sit for 2 to 3 minutes. Make sure to let the noodles steep for at least 2 minutes, so the vegetable bouillon cube has time to dissolve.

steps.headline: Mix the noodles well before eating.
steps.description: After the noodles have sat in the boiling water for a few minutes, remove the lid. Use a spoon to stir the mixture well, and enjoy.
